intro: Freziera canescens f. rufescens, commonly known as the red-haired freziera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy, grayish stems and small, white or pinkish flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and horticultural collections.
